sentences.sContent: Astronomers have detected an asteroid not far from Earth, moving in the same orbit around the Sun.
sentences.sContent_eng: Astronomers have detected an asteroid not far from Earth, moving in the same orbit around the Sun.
sentences.sCn: 天文学家在距离地球不远处发现一颗与地球绕日轨道相同的小行星。

sentences.sContent: He was an early proponent of the theory that life on Earth may have come from Mars in rocks ejected by asteroid and comet impacts.
sentences.sContent_eng: He was an early proponent of the theory that life on Earth may have come from Mars in rocks ejected by asteroid and comet impacts.
sentences.sCn: 他是这项理论早期的支持者：地球生命也许来自火星，通过小行星和彗星冲撞而由岩石喷射而出。

sentences.sContent: Moving on through the asteroid belt we enter the realms of the gas giant planets: Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune, all of which dwarf the Earth.
sentences.sContent_eng: Moving on through the asteroid belt we enter the realms of the gas giant planets: Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune, all of which dwarf the Earth.
sentences.sCn: 穿过小行星带继续前进，我们进入了气体巨行星区域：木星、土星、天王星、海王星，所有这些都使地球看起来像个侏儒。

synos.tran: [天]小行星；[无脊椎]海盘车；小游星

remMethod.val: aster(星星) + oid(像…一样) → 小行星

trans.tranOther: one of the many small  planet s  that move around the Sun, especially between Mars and Jupiter
